name: Westin St. Louis

reviews.text: This was my second stay at a Westin property. Recently built and architecturally one of the most interesting hotels I have ever stayed at. Beautiful, modern rooms. It feels completely integrated into the neighborhood, which is going through a tremendous amount of redevelopment. Although they have a health club, they do not have a pool. Nevertheless, I would gladly stay here again.
reviews.title: Fully Met Expectations

likes.disliked: — No pool and kind of hard to find.

reviews.title: Ahhh, so nice...
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for two nights for a conference. Man, was it nice! The lobby of the hotel is full of comfy chairs and sofas, and they offer free appetizers down there every weeknight (and free wi-fi access in the lobby all the time). There is also an Avis office within the hotel, which was convenient for us.

reviews.title: Would never stay anywhere else!!!
reviews.text: The room was very spacious, and the bed was comfortable. Not too hard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: and not too soft--with plenty of pillows. The bathroom was also very spacious. Mine had a soaker tub and a large shower. The only bad thing I saw, and this is nitpicky only because I couldn't find anything else, was some mold on the grout of the shower. But the good completely outweighs the bad here.
reviews.title: Fabulous Stay

reviews.text: The location also can't be beat - right across from the Stadium and a Metro station and within walking distance to several good restaurants downtown, as well as the Arch. Overall, this was a wonderful stay for me, and I will definitely visit again when staying in St. Louis.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in town for the NCAA Hockey tournament and were fortunate enough to take advantage of a package deal that allowed us to stay at the Westin.
reviews.title: As Advertised

likes.liked: — Comfort of the rooms and convenience to so many attractions.
likes.disliked: — The restaurant needed a few more options, especially for breakfast.

reviews.title: Very good hotel
reviews.text: Hotel is across the street from Busch Stadium and only a short walk to the Scottrade Center, Union Station and the Arch.

reviews.title: Outstanding Experience at the Westin St. Louis
reviews.text: Metrolink drops you from the airport to the front doors of the Hotel, and we took advantage of it as well.

reviews.title: Top Class Hotel – highly recommended
reviews.text: Concierge and doormen were of more help than the front desk, but all made our stay a pleasant one!
If we're ever back in St. Louis the Westin will be our first choice.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, very clean and comfortable, good area!
Will be back
reviews.text: We stayed here over the 4th of July weekend. The hotel is super posh - we loved it. Our room looked out at the stadium (we were there for some baseball games so this was fine with us). We rode the metro from the airport to the hotel and it drops you off right in front of the hotel. The bed was very very comfortable. The bathroom is huge! We had a big tub and a stand alone shower and the sink has plenty of counterspace. The hotel restaraunt is very good although a tad bit expensive. All in all a great stay and we would definitely stay here again.

reviews.title: You will not go wrong at the Westin
reviews.text: Our second visit to the Westin St Louis.

reviews.title: Overpriced, overrated
reviews.text: The beds are devine and the rooms spacious with good size well equiped bathrooms. It can be a long walk from the elivators to your room, but it is modern clean fresh., and very comfortable especialy if you have been traveling and need to relax.

reviews.title: Sheer delight
reviews.text: Sfaff were welcoming and helpful. Did not use the resturant this time as found the menu was trying to hard and had no clear theme. I look for simple food cooked very well and this was not for me. Also found that it was not great value for money and that there are good resturants nearby that offered better value.
Its generaly a good hotel with the stadium next to it, but be prepared to walk if you want anything else
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel in the Heart of Downtown
Comfortable Experience
reviews.text: We flew to Saint Louis with the express purpose of visiting the Pulitzer Museum. Neither of us had been to STL in over 20 yrs so weren't sure what to expect (but to be honest, our expectations were low - and to our surprise we enjoyed the city much more than we expected). We booked the Westin based on reviews from this site - and were very pleased with our choice. We rode the train from the airport to the hotel.
Upside:
reviews.title: Nice place to escape the heat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was smooth (desk staff were efficient although not overly friendly).
reviews.title: Appropriately comfortable
What a nice experience
reviews.text: Room was great - comfortable and quiet. Furnishings are nice (contemporary) but the TV seemed low tech and the furniture piece it is housed in appears cheap. Bed is wonderful although the pillows are flat. Very nice large bathroom.
Food in the restaurant was good - not excellent - but good. Valet/Bell guys were tops.
reviews.title: Outstanding!

description: Located in the historic Cupples Station section of St. Louis, the Westin St. Louis boasts a premiere setting. Enjoy the nearby federal courthouse, pedestrian mall, and famed Gateway Arch. Watch a Cardinals game at Busch stadium or just explore the city. A convenient Avis car rental onsite makes getting around easy.Your experience at the Westin St. Louis will be sure to engage the senses, with an interactive display kitchen at the delicious Clark Street Grill.Reenergize and renew in our Solera Health Club & Spa, a full-service spa featuring a selection of soothing signature treatments including massage, body treatments, and facials. Our full service business center allows you to take care of any last-minute details if you are hosting an event in one of our various meeting spaces.The guest rooms and suites at the Westin St. Louis are beautifully appointed, with contemporary conveniences such as High Speed Internet Access, and our signature Heavenly Bed®. Boasting high ceilings and a separate soaking tub, you are sure to stay relaxed during your stay.
